title: Broiled Tilapia Oreganata
summary: Broiled Tilapian Oreganata might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe serves 1. One serving contains 836 calories, 119g of protein, and 30g of fat. For $10.74 per serving, this recipe covers 46% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 110 people found this recipe to be tasty and satisfying. Head to the store and pick up seasoned breadcrumbs, salt, oregano, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the pepper you could follow this main course with the Easy Peppermint Dessert as a dessert. It is a good option if you're following a dairy free and pescatarian diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 97%. This score is tremendous. Similar recipes include Broiled Tilapia Gyros, Broiled Parmesan Tilapia, and Broiled Tilapia With Garlic.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are my top picks for Tilapia. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Santa Margherita Pinot Grigio with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 26 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Santa Margherita Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: A pale straw yellow. Clean, crisp fragrance with intense yet elegant hints of quince. Fresh, harmonious fruit set off by slight sweetness with a long finish full of delicate, tangy flavor.
